column2: In this study, we divide word similarity into two
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: categories: taxonomic similarity and associative
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: similarity. Taxonomic similarity, or categorical
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: similarity, is a kind of semantic similarity between
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words in the same level of categories or clusters of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the thesaurus, in particular synonyms, antonyms,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and other coordinates. Associative similarity, on
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the other hand, is a similarity between words that
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: are associated with each other by virtue of seman-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tic relations other than taxonomic one such as a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: collocational relation and a proximity relation. For
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: example, the word writer and the word author are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: taxonomically similar because they are synonyms,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: while the word writer and the word book are as-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sociatively similar because they are associated by
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: virtue of an agent-subject relation.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower
